text: The Australia Singapore Cable (ASC) is a 4,600 km fibre-optic submarine communications cable that entered service in September 2018, linking Australia and Singapore via Christmas Island and Indonesia. ASC is owned and operated by Vocus Communications and interconnects with the Vocus Australian domestic optical fibre network at the Australian landing site in Perth. The ASC consists of four fibre pairs and, at launch, had a total design capacity of 40 terabits per second. In 2019 the cable was upgraded to a total design capacity of 60 terabits per second. ==Landing points== #Perth, Western Australia #Flying Fish Cove, Christmas Island #Anyer, Indonesia #Tanah Merah, Singapore ==See also== * Other Australian international submarine cables (and year of first service): ** INDIGO-West (2019) ** Hawaiki Cable (2018) ** Pipe Pacific Cable (2009) ** Telstra Endeavour (2008) ** Australia–Japan Cable (2001) ** Southern Cross Cable (2000) ** SEA-ME-WE 3 (2000, Australian portion in service earlier) ** JASURAUS (1997) ** PacRimWest (1995) ==References== Category:Submarine communications cables in the Indian Ocean Category:Australia–Singapore relations
title: Australia Singapore Cable
